title: Handbook of professional ethics for psychologists : issues, questions, and controversies

description: Rather than take ethical pronouncements as dogma, simply understood & observed, this text encourages a critical attitude to issues that include confidentiality, financial matters, the termination & referral of clients, the use of deception in research, ethnic minority issues & consent in the treatment of children.
contributor: O'Donohue, William T., editor.$$QO'Donohue, William T.
Ferguson, Kyle E., editor.$$QFerguson, Kyle E.
contents: Ethics : the good, the bad, and the ugly / William T. O'Donohue, Kyle E. Ferguson -- Philosophical foundations of professional ethics / Andrew Lloyd, John Hansen -- Thinking well about ethics / Michael Lavin -- Moral reasoning and development / Karl H. Hennig, Lawrence J. Walker -- Ethical principles of the psychology profession and professional competencies / Ype H. Poortinga, Karel A. Soudijn -- The mismeasure of psychologists / William T. O'Donohue, Jeffrey A. Buchanan -- Institutional review boards / Gregory J. Hayes -- Ethics and the allocation of healthcare / Nicholas A. Cummings -- Fees and financial arrangements / Robert Miranda, Jr., Brian P. Marx -- The termination and referral of clients / Natalie M. Rice, Victoria M. Follette -- Ethical principles of the psychology profession and involuntary commitment / Derek Truscott, Lori Goodkey -- Ethics of multiple and overlapping relationships / Janet Schank, Rachel Slater, Devjani Banerjee-Stevens, Thomas M. Skovholt -- Ideals and realities in the development and practice of informed consent / Markus Kemmelmeier, Deborah Davis, William C. Follette -- Seven "sins" of misdirection? / Markus Kemmelmeier, Deborah Davis, William C. Follette -- Confronting the ethical issues in the use of animals in biomedical and behavioral research / John P. Gluck, Jordan B. Bell, Melody Pearson-Bish -- Ethical considerations in psychological assessment / Henry E. Adams, Kristen A. Luscher -- Confidentiality in psychotherapy and related contexts / Nancy E. Tribbensee, Charles D. Claiborn -- Ethical principles of the psychology profession and ethnic minority issues / Gordon C. Nagayama Hall, Gayle Y. Iwamasa, Jessica N. Smith -- Sexual orientation and professional ethics / David W. Purcell, Stephanie Swann, Sarah E. Herbert -- Ethical issues for psychologists working with persons with developmental disabilities / W. Larry Williams, Kevin D. Williams -- Ethical principles of the psychology profession and correctional psychology / Linda E. Weinberger, Shoba Sreenivasan -- The central role of informed consent in ethical treatment and research with children / David F. Richards -- Ethical principles and practice in couple and family therapy / Steven R. Thorp, Alan E. Fruzzetti -- Ethics and the school psychologist / Susan Jacob-Timm -- Issues in the ethical treatment of older adults / Jane E. Fisher, Craig Yury.
relation: $$Cform$$VPrint version: Handbook of professional ethics for psychologists. Thousand Oaks, Calif. : SAGE Publications, ©2003$$QHandbook of professional ethics for psychologists.

abstract: Rather than take ethical pronouncements as dogma, simply understood & observed, this text encourages a critical attitude to issues that include confidentiality, financial matters, the termination & referral of clients, the use of deception in research, ethnic minority issues & consent in the treatment of children.
